newsitem.title: USA: Whirlpool earnings hurt by charge, weak European results.
newsitem.headline: Whirlpool earnings hurt by charge, weak European results.

text.p: Whirlpool Corp. Monday reported a sharp drop in third-quarter earnings, blaming a huge restructuring charge and weak results in its European home-appliance business.
The company said it earned $21 million, or 28 cents a share, in the latest quarter, down from $64 million, or 85 cents a share, a year earlier. Sales rose to $2.20 billion from $2.15 billion.

Whirlpool said its third-quarter results included a pretax restructuring charge of $30 million, or 25 cents per share, for a previously announced streamlining of its Asian headquarters and a North American refrigeration operation.
It said a squeeze in profit margins in Europe more than offset strong gains in Latin America, where earnings jumped 30 percent from a year ago.
Whirlpool's stock was off 12.5 cents at $48.375 on the New York Stock Exchange.
